children.subject: Enrollment priority* not appointment.
@944  This question would be best directed to the SIS development team
Is there a reason why the enrollment limit and enrollment appointment changes were made? The limit change in particular doesn't seem to make any sense...
That's a great question, and I apologize for not clarifying. This is for students who are declared CS or EECS only. You'll have access to faculty advising as soon as you're declared :)

Followup on this, how does this work if we won't be officially in the major until grades from this semester come out? Say I phase 1 R1B and 61C before I'm in the major, and then get in and want to phase 2 170, would I be able to do this normally?
Yes

I'm confused on the faculty advising part because I'm not declared LSCS yet (will be after this semester) so I have no connection with any faculty advising. Does this only apply after I declare my major after this semester or does this apply to me now?

You are still expected to attend faculty advising, as it is an important opportunity to connect with faculty to discuss enrollment choices, careers, research, graduate school, and any other questions you might have. If you have any concerns about limited interactions/relationships with faculty, it would be wise to attend.
I'm not really required to attend faculty advising if I don't have any question for them?
"Spring 2016 & Summer 2016 graduating seniors are not required to participate in faculty advising."
i'm graduating this semester. can i ignore the faculty advising email that was sent to me?
No, the campus & SIS team decided to now longer allow this.
For the new CalCentral system, are we able to take classes that have a time conflict like we were able to in TeleBears?
http://www.eecs.berkeley.edu/Programs/student-faq.html
advising faq not found?
are you eecs or lscs?
lscs
intend to take would be great if you know what wanted you wanted to take.
For the degree worksheet, are we supposed to write what we intend to take (for requirements that we have not yet completed) or just leave it blank?

history.content:
(Faculty advising is for students declared in EECS or LSCS only)

Dear Students,

As you may know, the university has shifted to a new system, CalCentral. Through this system, you can access information on financial aid, advising, class enrollment, and register for Fall 2016 classes. It is our hope that  this new system will be much simpler than the numerous systems we previously used. **This email contains important information you need to know for the Fall 2016 enrollment cycle**

Important Dates:

  • Monday (3/28) @ 10 am: Continuing students will have the opportunity to keep or change their adviser from last semester on the Faculty Advising web app. If you want to keep your adviser, select the faculty’s name and click “Save”.  If you want to change your adviser, select "(blank)" and click "Save". You will have until March 29th to make this selection.  If you opt to select a new adviser, you will be able to do so beginning March 30th.
  • Monday (3/28): Schedule of Classes & Schedule Planner available on Cal Central
    • We will do our best to make as few changes to the schedule as possible once it goes live, however please be aware that changes may occur before Phase I begins. Make sure to check the online schedule regularly for changes.
  • Wednesday (3/30) @ 10am: Sign-ups for all students will occur on a first-come, first-served basis on the Faculty Advising web app.
    • IMPORTANT: Students are responsible for selecting an advising time that does not conflict with their schedule. Please make your selections wisely.
  • April 4th-14th: Attend your faculty advising session/appointment with your questions and ALL your completed forms
  • April 18-July 14: Phase I Enrollment Appointments
  • July 15- August 12: Phase II Enrollment Appointments
  • August 15- October 28: Enrollment Adjustment Period 

Enrollment Information:

You should now be able to see your enrollment appointments. Log in to Cal Central / My Academics. On the right side of the screen you will see your enrollment card. Under the Fall 2016 enrollment section, you should see your appointment dates under #4 "Decide." If you do not see your appointments, please visit studentcentral.berkeley.edu/open-case

 You can find a video tutorial of what the new enrollment system will look like here. We will continue to update you as we learn more about the new system!
 
Important changes:

  • The enrollment limits of 10.5 and 16 units for Phase I and Phase II are now “hard limits” and students will not be able to enroll beyond them.
  • Enrollment appointments will no longer be limited to a 24 hour period. The window will stay open until the end of that phase. You can register any time after your enrollment window opens. 
  • Enrollment priority is now based on number of terms in attendance rather than units earned.
  • For this semester only, adviser codes will not be required. You are still expected to attend faculty advising, as it is an important opportunity to connect with faculty to discuss enrollment choices, careers, research, graduate school, and any other questions you might have. 

What do I bring to my faculty advising session?
EECS Students should:

1. Print and complete the Tele-BEARS form.

2. Print and bring a copy of your unofficial transcript from BearFacts or Cal Central

3. Print and complete the correct EECS Degree Worksheet based on first year of enrollment at Cal  2011-2013 | 2014 | 2015

LSCS Students should

1. Print and complete the Tele-BEARS form.

2. Print and complete the LSCS Degree Worksheet.

3. Print a copy of your Bear Facts unofficial transcript.  


I am graduating this semester. Do I need advising?
Spring 2016 & Summer 2016 graduating seniors are not required to participate in faculty advising.

  • EECS students graduating in Spring or Summer 2016 should meet with their ESS Adviser to confirm they have successfully completed their degree.
  • L&S CS students graduating in Spring or Summer 2016 should meet with the CS Major Advisers, and an L&S College Adviser to confirm they have successfully completed their degree.

For more information on faculty advising see our FAQ or email me directly.
 
Thank you in advance for your patience while we go through this big transition together!
history.subject: Important Fall 2016 Enrollment & Fauclty Advising Information

history.content:

As you may know, the university has shifted to a new system, CalCentral. Through this system, you can access information on financial aid, advising, class enrollment, and register for Fall 2016 classes. It is our hope that  this new system will be much simpler than the numerous systems we previously used. **This email contains important information you need to know for the Fall 2016 enrollment cycle**

You will have until March 29th to make this selection.  If you opt to select a new adviser, you will be able to do so beginning March 30th.

  • EECS students graduating in Spring or Summer 2016 should meet with their ESS Adviser to confirm they have successfully completed their degree.
